title: Iran's President says his country is in full-scale war with West
description: Pezeshkian said the West’s war against Iran is “more complicated and more difficult” compared to the 1980-1988 war with Iraq

title: Maharashtra: SIT probe finds China link to kidney racket
description: A Special Investigation Team in Chandrapur has uncovered a direct link to China in the illegal sale of a farmer's kidney. Interrogations revealed that a Chinese surgeon, Dr. Chiang, conducted transplants in Cambodia and supplied harvested organs to Chinese clients, including the kidney of a local farmer.

title: Morning habits to naturally reduce stress hormone: ‘Do EFT every day’
Myanmar’s first elections since 2021 are being termed a ‘sham’. Here is why
Polls open for military-ruled Myanmar’s first election in 5 years
‘Dhurandhar’ collection day 23: Ranveer Singh starrer crosses Rs 1025cr mark worldwide
description: Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar' continues its phenomenal run, crossing Rs. 660 crore domestically and Rs. 1025 crore worldwide in its fourth week. Despite new releases, the film maintains its box office dominance.  Recent weekend collections show strong performance, with Saturday adding Rs. 20.50 crore to its impressive total.

title: Video | Pilot dies after ultralight plane crashes into sea off Rio’s Copacabana beach
Connoisseurs and converts enjoy a concoction of coffee, Carnatic music

Yamuna sand mining: Mid-river digs to illegal ramps, NGT panel finds major violations
description: A National Green Tribunal-ordered inspection of Yamuna floodplains revealed large-scale violations by miners, including operating heavy machinery within the river's flow and exceeding legal lease boundaries. The joint committee's report highlighted administrative lapses and recommended urgent action against illegal mining and short-term leases.

title: Aravalli definition row back in Supreme Court, hearing tomorrow
After 35 years, I claimed my surname: Neeraj Ghaywan on Homebound and why empathy is the need of the hour
description: The filmmaker distinguishes himself through his commitment to authentic, intersectional storytelling that centres around marginalised experiences — particularly those shaped by caste, class, gender, and religious identity. Now, his second feature film, based on Basharat Peer’s moving op-ed ‘Taking Amrit Home’ in The New York Times, has begun its Oscar journey

title: Noida: Cloth found in woman’s abdomen 15 months after C-section; FIR against 6 doctors
description: A criminal case has been filed against three doctors and health officials after a nearly half-meter surgical cloth was found inside a woman's abdomen over a year after her delivery. The foreign object, left during a C-section in November 2023, caused persistent pain and complications before its removal in April. The woman's husband alleges negligence and threats during the investigation.

title: What expands us makes us stronger
AI can mimic Van Gogh. Can it replace the struggle that made him great?
One word, a whole world
Two weeks before Supreme Court accepted 100-m Aravalli norm, its panel cautioned on mining leases
Degrees of disillusionment in Tamil Nadu’s government colleges, universities
description: Judging by headlines alone, faculty members across government colleges and universities in Tamil Nadu have spent the better half of the past two years in upheaval over a plethora of issues that are yet to be resolved. A fair pay scale, timely promotions and clearance of pending increments, regularisation of the services of part-time and temporary employees, restoration of special pay provisions and revival of the old pension scheme are among their demands. Nahla Nainar explains the key issues plaguing higher education in the State

title: Chennai scores well in terms of housing sales
description: The data also pointed out that Chennai added approximately 27,190 units in 2025, an annual increase of 30% against the previous year

title: An educationist considers some crucial differences between higher education institutes in India and the U.S.
description: Indian institutions can emulate some of the best educational practices from American HEIs to empower their students

title: The new world of surrendered left-wing extremists
description: The lives of those involved in the Maoist movement remain largely hidden, shaped by a culture of secrecy. Satyasundar Barik speaks with several surrendered red-corridor workers, who describe how their lives have changed since giving up arms and what life inside the Maoist ranks truly looks like

title: Twist in court: 2nd husband testifies for 1st; woman loses 17-year old DV case
description: A 17-year-old domestic violence case took an unexpected turn when a woman's current husband testified, confirming her second marriage. This revelation led a Borivli court to rule she was no longer entitled to maintenance from her ex-husband, effectively ending her claim for protection and monetary relief initiated in 2009.

title: Russia strikes Ukraine's capital killing one, day before Zelenskyy-Trump meeting
description: Explosions boomed across Kyiv as the attack began in early morning and continued for hours

title: Old & bold: When 70+ go skydiving & bungee jumping
description: A group of over 70 Indians, defying age and physical limitations, are embracing adventure. From skydiving and scuba diving to trekking in Antarctica, these seniors are living life to the fullest. Couples like the Kotharis, Thakors, and Vakils are proving that age is merely a number, prioritizing experiences and curiosity over potential hardships, with their bucket lists still growing.

title: Kennedy Center chief seeks $1m after drummer Chuck Redd cancels Christmas Eve show

title: Pune civic polls: As NCP talks hit dead-end, Sharad Pawar’s party rushes back to MVA
Rajasthan: Over 1,230 mine leases exist across Aravalis in the state
description: Rajasthan's Aravali region grapples with over 1,230 disputed mining leases, impacting 17,393 hectares. Despite a central ban on new leases following public outcry, existing operations continue, causing visible environmental damage like denuded hills and disrupted drainage. Rajsamand, Udaipur, and Jaipur districts bear the brunt of this extensive mining footprint.

title: 'If God granted me a wish': Ex-cricketer makes emotional plea for Kohli's Test return
description: Former cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu wants Virat Kohli to return to Test cricket.  Kohli retired from Tests in May 2025 after a successful career.  He continues to perform well in One Day Internationals.  Recent performances in Australia and South Africa show his enduring form.  This has led to calls for his Test comeback.

title: Residents resort to road roko after two deaths in Tiruttani
description: Locals allege the deaths were caused by contaminated drinking water; health officials say food and water samples are being collected for testing

Managing old age
description: Embrace it as a meaningful part of life; strive for independence, cooperate with caregivers, and avoid being overly demanding

title: ‘Don't Get Scammed': Stop, think & then act before letting fear take over
description: Cybercrime transcends borders, exploiting anonymity and human emotions like greed and fear, according to Special CP Devesh Chandra Srivastava.  He highlighted that even educated individuals fall prey to scams by understanding psychological triggers, emphasizing personal awareness as the primary defense against evolving threats like AI-driven frauds and deepfakes.

title: UP boy who saved dad from crocodile wants to protect nation
description: A nine-year-old boy, Ajay Raj Nishad, received the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar for his bravery after saving his father from a crocodile attack in the Chambal river. Armed with a stick, Ajay struck the predator's eye, forcing it to release his father. Inspired by the award ceremony, Ajay aspires to join the defence forces.

description: Good mental health isn’t just about being happy; it’s about feeling supported, seen, and safe to speak without judgment

description: Regulator devises scheme for testing packaged drinking water and mineral water; directs manufacturers to comply with it from January 1; consumer groups urge authorities to ensure periodic inspections at plants and shut unauthorised units

title: Centre deliberates on suggestions by states, UTs on PM-POSHAN

description: The Supreme Court has taken suo motu cognizance of its November 20 order on the Aravali hills, registering a new case to address concerns raised by environmentalists. The previous ruling defined Aravali hills for mining purposes as landforms with 100m elevation, a definition critics argue will lead to extensive mining and damage the range's integrity.

title: 'I'm Indian': Tripura student's last words before he was killed in a racial attack
description: A 24-year-old MBA student from Tripura tragically died after confronting men who hurled racial slurs at him and his brother in Dehradun. The brutal stabbing occurred when the victim asserted his Indian identity.  The incident has sparked outrage and calls for justice, with protests erupting across the northeast and student organizations demanding a national law against racial hate crimes.

title: Fond memories of a venerable guru
description: A student remembers musician T.M. Thyagarajan

title: BJP: Rahul permanent spokesperson of anti-India global forces
description: BJP alleges Congress is a mouthpiece for anti-India global forces, citing Sam Pitroda's confirmation of the party's membership in George Soros-linked Global Progressive Alliance.  Rahul Gandhi's role in its presidium is highlighted, questioning his foreign visits and meetings with anti-India entities. BJP demands answers on Congress's priorities.

description: While traditional pharmacology aims to ‘chemically correct’ the disrupted body metabolism without addressing the root cause, gene therapy offers the potential for a proper cure.

IndiGo fiasco: DGCA official removed, more action likely
description: Following IndiGo's recent operational chaos, the DGCA is cracking down. The head of flight standards has been removed, with other officials facing scrutiny. This comes amid widespread criticism that the DGCA needs a complete overhaul, moving towards an independent, self-funded authority like those in the US and Europe. Recent incidents highlight systemic issues across aviation agencies.

title: What are India’s diplomatic headwinds in 2026?: Explained

title: Unnao rape case: CBI cites Advani judgment to seek Sengar bail nixing
description: The CBI has urged the Supreme Court to overturn a Delhi High Court decision that excluded MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar from being prosecuted under the POCSO Act. Citing the L K Advani case, the CBI argued that lawmakers, as public servants, should face stricter penalties for offenses involving children, emphasizing their public trust and authority.

title: What are the signals from the Indian economy? | Explained
description: What measures have the government taken to boost demand and growth?

title: Himachal Pradesh: Govt doctors launch indefinite strike; healthcare services hit
description: Himachal Pradesh government hospitals saw services halt Saturday as doctors struck indefinitely. They demand the reinstatement of a doctor sacked for assaulting a patient, arguing his side was ignored. While emergency care continues, non-urgent procedures are postponed, causing significant patient hardship. Officials are working towards a resolution.

title: Energy Minister asks officials to fast-track RDSS projects

title: Resolution on Bangladesh unrest: Congress drops blame on govt after Tharoor objects
description: A Congress Working Committee meeting saw a resolution blaming the government for Bangladesh's situation, but Shashi Tharoor suggested rephrasing, arguing the government could be accused of diplomatic failure, not direct blame for unrest. The line was subsequently dropped.

title: G RAM G’s core spirit rooted in Bapu’s ideals, says Shivraj
description: Rural development minister Shivraj Chouhan has accused the Congress of spreading misinformation about the VB-G RAM G law, alleging they previously cut MGNREGA's budget and froze wages. He stated the new act ensures transparency and tangible benefits for workers, countering claims of removing Mahatma Gandhi's ideals. Chouhan asserted the VB-G RAM G Act embodies Gandhian principles for rural development.

Singh advocated for decentralization within Congress, criticizing its over-centralized structure. The BJP seized on his remarks to attack the Congress leadership, contrasting their approach with Modi's rise.

The peaceful Hindu gathering was met with anti-India and anti-Hindu slogans from the counter-protestors, prompting police intervention.

description: Rahman said his plan was for “all Bangladeshis — a united, inclusive Bangladesh, a Bangladesh that moves forward together”

title: Mirwaiz bio change controversy: Sajad Lone alleges surrender for protocol
description: Sajad Lone criticized Mirwaiz Umar Farooq's decision to remove his Hurriyat chairman title from X, calling it a "surrender for protocol and security." Lone accused the cleric of double standards, recalling past vilification. Mirwaiz cited UAPA bans and restricted communication as reasons for his "Hobson's choice." PDP and NC supported Mirwaiz, blaming authorities.

title: Psychic Star should win the Maharaja Jiwajirao Scindia Trophy

title: M.P. Congress media head quits amid discontent rumours; party declines resignation

title: Protest held outside Jammu Lok Bhavan over MBBS admission row
description: Protesters in Jammu demanded the cancellation of MBBS admissions at SMVDIME, citing that 42 out of 50 seats went to Muslim candidates. Activists, joined by BJP members and trade leaders, argued for Hindu-only reservations. The Sangharsh Samiti vows to continue the protest until their demands, linked to faith, are met.

title: Stephen Curry responds to backlash over Ayesha Curry’s marriage remarks
description: Stephen Curry and his wife, Ayesha Curry, have been getting brutally trolled over the last few months, ever since she made some controversial remarks about their marriage. As the couple continues to get trolled, Stephen Curry has finally broken his silence on it as he addressed the hate his wife receives on a regular basis.

title: Maldini & Andriana Fossa net worth 2025: AC Milan legacy, earnings and life
description: Paolo Maldini and Adriana Fossa built their life with patience, privacy, and balance. His long career at AC Milan created most of their wealth, while Adriana chose family over fame. By 2025, their story stands out for quiet success, lasting marriage, and a drama-free legacy rooted in respect.

description: A three-judge Special Vacation Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant will hear the matter.

description: It was Mr. Saraogi’s first meeting with Mr. Shah and Mr. Nadda after being appointed as state president earlier this month. He also met Bihar in-charge Vinod Tawde.

title: J&K students association says another Kashmiri shawl seller assaulted
description: A Kashmiri shawl seller suffered severe injuries, including fractures, after an alleged assault in Himachal Pradesh. The J&K Students Association condemned the incident, marking it as the 16th targeting Kashmiri traders in the state this year. They urged the Himachal CM for immediate action. A similar harassment case in Haryana is also being addressed.

title: The making of Galileo
description: Twenty years ago, on December 28, 2005, Giove-A (Galileo In-Orbit Validation Element-A  for those who like their expansions) was launched, one of two demonstration satellites to test and validate Galileo technologies in orbit. Ten days ago, on December 17, 2025, two Galileo satellites lifted off, further strengthening Europe’s Galileo constellation. A.S.Ganesh tells you more about this Galileo and what it is up to…

title: Man City go top with 2-1 win at Forest after Cherki heroics
description: The French midfielder first threaded the pass for City's opener before striking ​an 83rd-minute winner from a set-piece to secure their eighth straight victory across ‌all competitions.

He emphasized the importance of preserving Assamese heritage amidst worrying demographic changes and what he sees as appeasement policies.
